frame.name: Simultaneity
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two <fen>Events</fen> happen at the same time. This may either be construed symmetrically as a relation holding between the <fen>Events</fen>, or asymmetrically as holding between a <fen>Landmark_event</fen> whose known occurrence is used to describe when a <fen>Profiled_event</fen> took place.
<ex><fex name="Events">These events</fex> <t>coincided</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Profiled_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The event which is asserted to occur at the same time as the <fen>Landmark_event</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Landmark_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The event or time period whose timing the Profiled_event is judged against.</def-root>

FE.name: Events
FE.definition: <def-root>The states-of-affairs which are asserted to be co-timed.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Profiled_event</fen> and <fen>Landmark_event</fen> coincide.
<ex>The attacks on the palace <fex name="deg">nearly</fex> <t>coincided</t> with the beginning of peace talks.</ex></def-root>
